summary: "Subject-matter jurisdiction," also known as "jurisdiction ratione materiae," refers to the authority of a court to adjudicate cases based on the specific subject matter involved. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this concept is crucial for delineating the scope of judicial power across various legal domains. It ensures that cases are heard by courts equipped with the requisite expertise to address particular legal issues. Understanding jurisdiction ratione materiae is essential for the effective organization of the legal system, as it facilitates the proper allocation of cases and upholds the principles of legal certainty and efficiency within the EU.
